Title.evidence: Sutureless Aortic Valve Replacement: A Retrospective Analysis

Participants.evidence: Participants included patients with moderate-to-severe aortic valve disease, with a mean age of 69.3 years and a mean logistic EuroSCORE-II of 5.2%.

Intervention.evidence: sutureless aortic valve replacement (SU-AVR) using the Perceval valve

Objective.evidence: This study aims to review our institutional experience with sutureless aortic valve replacement (SU-AVR) using the Perceval valve.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was mortality at various time points, and secondary outcomes included postoperative complications.

Number_Randomised.evidence: We conducted a retrospective analysis of 200 consecutive patients who underwent SU-AVR at a single center between December 2019 and February 2023.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In-hospital, 30-day, 6-month, and 1-year mortality rates were 4.5%, 6.5%, 7.5%, and 8.2%, respectively.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included re-exploration for bleeding in 7% of patients and permanent pacemaker implantation in 4%.
